CHAPTERS.TITLE: Student Chapters
CHAPTERS.CONTENT: Learn more about our student chapters!

BITCUP.TEXT: The Bit Cup is an open and free programming competition organized by IEEE ITBA. Due to its varied difficulty, you can use it as an introduction to the world of competitive programming.
BITCUP.TITLE: Bit Cup

IOT.TITLE: IoT Workshop
IOT.TEXT: In this workshop, the attendants will learn about the basis of Internet of Things (IoT) using Mqtt and NodeRED, starting with the motivation of its creation and ending with examples of modern applications. In addition, the students will work with a robotic arm to implement the concepts of the workshop.

ASIMOVCUP.TEXT: The Asimov Cup is a robotics competition open to the general public that takes place at ITBA. Competitors from any high school, university, or private team build their robots to compete with each other and find the winner in one of the three categories: Racing, Sumo and Minisumo.
ASIMOVCUP.TITLE: Asimov Cup

CLASSES.TEXT: In this course we teach our students the basic concepts of programming, and how to take the first steps using Python.  It’s aimed towards students, with or without experience in programming, and to everyone interested in learning one of the most popular programming languages.
CLASSES.TITLE: Introductory Python Course

COMPETITION.TEXT: We truly think that competition is capable of generating a healthy and ideal environment to challenge and transcend personal limits.
COMPETITION.TITLE: Competition

CONTACTS.TEXT: We foster the creation of new ties because we understand how fundamental the search and permanent renovation of connection is for any type of technological advancement.
CONTACTS.TITLE: Contacts

CONTACTUS.1: For general inquiries, send an email to
CONTACTUS.2: If you have questions about sponsorships or you are interested in sponsoring one of our events contact any Fundraising member.

HOME.DESC: We are a student organization from ITBA. Our objective is the development of technology and its aplications for humanity's advancement.

EDUCATION.TEXT: We believe in the great importance of developing pedagogical and didactic techniques as an indispensable motor for knowledge diffusion.
EDUCATION.TITLE: Education

IEEEXTREME.TEXT: IEEExtreme is an international competition with the particularity of lasting 24hs and occurring at the same time all over the world. IEEE-ITBA is the most important organizer in the country.
IEEEXTREME.TITLE: IEEExtreme Competition

DATAANALYSIS.TEXT: Thanks to the pack of graphical options along with visualization tools that make data more accessible, Python is named as the most preferred language among the data analysts and data scientists. With our course you will learn how to use some of these tools, only requiring having basic Python knowledge to do so.
DATAANALYSIS.TITLE: Data Analysis in Python Course

PROGCLUB.TEXT: We are working in the creation of a team that is composed by people with interest in increasing their passion for programming and develop their team, communication and technical skills. Programming is a skill that can always be further developed and the experience of competing is truly unique.
PROGCLUB.TITLE: Programmer Club

CS.TEXT: IEEE Computer Society is a technical society whose objective is to inspire and educate in different technology areas related to informatics. We are one of the biggest networks that connect professionals around the globe. In ITBA we organize activities related to modern technologies aiming to make interested people such as students to learn more.
CS.TITLE: Computer Society

WIE.TEXT: Our objective is to promote gender diversity in tech through education and representation.
WIE.TITLE: Women in Engineering

ABOUTUS.PAGEDESCRIPTION: IEEE ITBA is a non-profit student organization that represents the IEEE at the Technological Institute of Buenos Aires.

US.TITLE: Who we are
US.TEXT: IEEE-ITBA is a non-profit student organization that represents the IEEE at the Technological Institute of Buenos Aires.

OBJECTIVE.TITLE: Objective
OBJECTIVE.TEXT: We seek to spread technical knowledge to the community, promoting open access to technological tools and organizing activities focused on electronics and programming.

MISSION.TITLE: Mission
MISSION.TEXT: As students, we aspire to strengthen professional skills and generate contacts from the student cycle.

TEAM.PAGEDESCRIPTION: IEEE ITBA is based on the hard work of our members in their different fields, get to know them.
TEAM.TITLE: Team
TEAM.SUBTITLE: IEEE ITBA is based on the hard work of our members in their different fields, get to know them.

NEWS.PAGEDESCRIPTION: Find out the latest technological and scientific news!
NEWS.RATING: What do you think about the post?

IEEEXTREME.PAGEDESCRIPTION: IEEExtreme is an international programming competition that lasts 24 hours. It is organized by IEEE-ITBA and is the most important in the country.

PARTICIPATE.TEXT: Contact us via ieee@itba.edu.ar for more information and we'll notify you when registration opens. In the meantime, you can get yourself a team and start training!
PARTICIPATE.TITLE: Want to participate?

SPONSORSHIP.TEXT: In order to take part in the competition we require founding, that is why we are in the looking for new sponsors for our event. For more information please contact any member of our fundraising team:
SPONSORSHIP.TITLE: Sponsors who support us

TEAM.TEXT: The IEEExtreme programming competition lasts 24hs, where competitors of different universities and studies dedicate a great effort and motivation with the sole purpose of incrementing their problem solving abilities as a team have a great time in the process.
TEAM.TITLE: Tackle problems as a team!

BITCUP.PAGEDESCRIPTION: The Bit Cup is an open and free programming competition organized by IEEE ITBA where participants attempt to solve several challenges within a limited time.
BITCUP.DESCRIPTION-TEXT: The Bit Cup is an open and free programming competition organized by IEEE ITBA where participants attempt to solve several challenges within a limited time. You can use it as practice for the IEEEXtreme and enter the world of competitive programming!
BITCUP.FORMAT-TEXT: This competition consists of solving a series of challenges released as the competition develops. It is graded from a set of test cases so that your score increases as you pass more test cases. Memory limits and processing time will need to be taken into account.
BITCUP.LEVEL-TEXT: The difficulty of each challenge is varied so make sure that those less experienced will also be able to participate.

PYTHONCOURSES.PAGEDESCRIPTION: Introductory Python course organized by IEEE ITBA. Learn the basic concepts of programming and take your first steps in Python.

CLASSES.C1: Introduction to Python programming, Variables, Operators, Control Flow (if-else, while and for loop), Functions
CLASSES.C2: Data Types:(int, float, string, boolean), Data type operations, Lists, List operations, Text file manipulation
CLASSES.C3: Data structures(Dictionary, Set, Tuple), Data structure operations, Introduction to libraries and examples, Application cases
CLASSES.TITLE: Class

PYTHONCOURSES.DESC: This course is part of a series of courses we offer, with the main goal of learning how to automate simple tasks, efficient file and spreadsheet manipulation, and creating visual data representations. We believe that all of these tasks can be achieved through programming, without the need to become an expert in the topic. The contents of this introductory course are oriented towards people with no Python experience. We will go over the basics and fundamentals of programming and the Python language, putting into practice what we learn through interactive challenges and practical exercises.
PYTHONCOURSES.FORMAT: The classes on this course consist of text and video explanations, with the addition of interactive challenges to solve. There will be a week between classes to read and solve these challenges, while being able to chat with us and the rest of the participants using Discord. In addition to this, we will have weekly livestreams to answer your questions.

QUESTIONS.TEXT: We opened a SubReddit to answer questions:
QUESTIONS.TEXT_VIDEOS: Check our live videos with more info about our classes !
QUESTIONS.TITLE: Questions

PYTHONCOURSES.TITLE: Introductory Python Course

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Do I need to have experience programming?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: No! We will explain everything from scratch, with a nice pace.

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Will I receive a certificate after finishing the course?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: Yes! You will get a certificate after completing the mandatory programming challenges before their respective due date.

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Who can enter this course?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: This course is free and open to everyone. Since it’s oriented towards a professional environment, it’s advisable, though not mandatory, to have finished high school.

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: How can I ask questions or ask for help?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: We will communicate through Discord, where we have our own server with voice and text channels. There we will answer your questions during the week, and any remaining questions will be answered during the livestreams.

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Can I interact with the rest of the participants?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: Definitely! We encourage you to think of your own solutions to the challenges alongside your partners, ask for help if you’re stuck, and offer help to others in need. This will also be done through Discord.

INTRO.TITLE: Acceptance of Policies and Registration Conditions and Event Participation
INTRO.TEXT:
The following terms and conditions apply to all events organized by the IEEE ITBA Student Chapter. Before signing up you recognize and agree to the Terms and Conditions in this document. If you do not agree to the Terms and Conditions you should not sign up.
IEEE ITBA as an organization belonging to IEEE and ITBA, adhere to the terms and conditions of the organization and institution, respectively. In addition, all illegal activity or behavior in respect to the Argentina law will be considered an infraction of these Terms and Conditions.

IEEE.TITLE: Terms and Conditions of IEEE Events

INTRO.START: As an organization belonging to the IEEE, you are reminded that by agreeing to and accepting the Terms and Conditions of IEEE ITBA events, you are simultaneously agreeing to and accepting the Terms and Conditions of IEEE Events Singups. A complete list of these Terms and Conditions is available in
INTRO.END: The following sections are especially mentioned:

1.TITLE: Nondiscrimination policy
1.TEXT: “IEEE prohibits discrimination, harassment, and bullying against any person for any reason—for example, because of age, ancestry, color, disability or handicap, national origin, race, religion, gender, sexual or affectional orientation, gender identity, appearance, matriculation, political affiliation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.” Examples can be found in the IEEE policy.

2.TITLE: Event conduct and safety
2.TEXT:
“IEEE is committed to providing a safe, productive, and welcoming environment to all participants, including staff and vendors, at IEEE-related events. IEEE has no tolerance for discrimination, harassment, or bullying in any form at IEEE-related events. Participants are expected to adhere to these principles and respect the rights of others.
What To Do If You Witness or are Subjected to Unacceptable Behavior:  Participants should report any behavior inconsistent with these principles to onsite event staff. Event staff will be happy to help participants contact venue security or local law enforcement, provide escorts, or otherwise assist those experiencing harassment to feel safe for the duration of the event. We value your attendance.”

3.TITLE: Usage of photographic and video material taken at IEEE events
3.TEXT: As found in its respective section in the IEEE Events Terms and Conditions.

ITBA.TITLE: IEEE ITBA Terms and Conditions
ITBA.INTRO: The Terms and Conditions proposed by the IEEE ITBA student chapter for event registration and participation are detailed as follows.

1.TITLE: Age restrictions
1.TEXT: By signing up to this event you declare that you are a legal adult at the time of registration.

2.TITLE: Use of participants information
2.TEXT: IEEE ITBA reserves the right to use the contact information provided by participants during registration, with enterprises that have collaborated towards the realization of the event organized by the IEEE ITBA student chapter.

3.TITLE: IEEExtreme
3.TEXT:
All Rules, Terms and Conditions of the corresponding IEEExtreme edition apply at the time of inscription. You are reminded to use sensible team names that do not violate the terms and conditions established by IEEE.
During the IEEExtreme direct private communication between participants of different teams are not allowed without previous explicit authorization in the public conversation hall between the involved parties.
All communication between individuals or teams during the event have to adhere to the Terms and Conditions previously mentioned.
The use of any tool violating the Terms and Conditions of the event is prohibited.
If a member of the event staff considers that there has been a violation of these Terms and Conditions, the infractor will be warned. If such behavior persists, IEEE ITBA reserves the right to expel the participant from the event.

DATAANALYSIS.PAGETITLE: ITBA IEEE | Data Analysis in Python Course
DATAANALYSIS.PAGEDESCRIPTION: Data Analysis in Python course organized by IEEE ITBA. Learn how to use Python for data analysis and visualization.

CLASSES.C1: Introduction to libraries (review), Writing and reading of Excel and CSV files and Data manipulation with Pandas
CLASSES.C2: Introduction to matplotlib, Data visualization, Customization of plots and graphs and Application cases
CLASSES.TITLE: Class

DATAANALYSIS.DESC:
This course is part of a series of courses we offer, with the main goal of learning how to automate simple tasks, efficient file and spreadsheet manipulation, and creating visual data representations. We believe that all of these tasks can be achieved through programming without the need to become an expert in the topic.

The contents of this course are oriented towards people who are already familiar with the basics of Python programming (such as data types, functions and data structures). We will go over the basics and fundamentals of libraries, file reading and data analysis and representation, putting into practice what we learn through interactive challenges and practical exercises.
DATAANALYSIS.FORMAT: The classes on this course consist of text and video explanations, with the addition of interactive challenges to solve. There will be a week between classes to read and solve these challenges, while being able to chat with us and the rest of the participants using Discord. In addition to this, we will have weekly livestreams to answer your questions.
DATAANALYSIS.CONTENT_DESC: The course consists of 2 classes covering the following topics, to access the contents of the classes and the solutions you can click on the corresponding button.
DATAANALYSIS.TITLE: Data Analysis in Python Course

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Do I need to have experience programming?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: For this course, some basic experience with Python will be necessary (flow control, data structures, etc.). If you completed our introductory course, then you are ready for this one!

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Will I receive a certificate after finishing the course?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: Yes! You will get a certificate after completing a quiz before the end of the course.

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Who can enter this course?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: This course is free and open to everyone. Since it’s oriented towards a professional environment, it’s advisable, though not mandatory, to have finished high school. We strongly recommend to have finished primary school.

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: How can I ask questions or ask for help?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: We will communicate through Discord, where we have our own server with voice and text channels. There we will answer your questions during the week, and any remaining questions will be answered during the livestreams.

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Can I interact with the rest of the participants?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: Definitely! We encourage you to think of your own solutions to the challenges alongside your partners, ask for help if you’re stuck, and offer help to others in need. This will also be done through Discord.

IEEEMEETUP.TITLE: IEEE - 2nd Meet Up
IEEEMEETUP.CONTENT: In this IEEE Meeting, the complete IEEE Team will discuss according and what it has and has not accomplished, the actual situation and the proposed ideas how to continue the rest of the year. It this the perfect moment to make the kickoff for new activites! You can share topics you want to be discussed in the form!

IEEENEWS.TITLE: IEEE News
IEEENEWS.CONTENT: ¡Accede a la página de noticias de IEEE ITBA!

WHO-WE-ARE.TITLE: Who we are
WHO-WE-ARE.DESC:
IEEE-ITBA is a non-profit student organization that represents the IEEE at the Technological Institute of Buenos Aires.
We seek to spread technical knowledge to the community, promoting open access to technological tools and organizing activities focused on electronics and programming.
As students, we aspire to strengthen professional skills and generate contacts from the student cycle.

WHAT-IS-IEEE.TITLE: What is IEEE?
WHAT-IS-IEEE.DESC:
The Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) is the world's largest professional technical society, with more than 400,000 members in 160 different countries. Its main purpose is to promote technological innovation and excellence for the benefit of humanity.
IEEE and its members inspire the global community through publications, conferences, and technology standards along with professional and educational activities.

WHAT-IS-ITBA.TITLE: What is the ITBA?
WHAT-IS-ITBA.DESC:
The Technological Institute of Buenos Aires (ITBA) is the only private university in Argentina that specializes in Technology, Engineering, and Management.
For 60 years, it has contributed to solving the challenges of humanity through university education of recognized excellence, the production of scientific knowledge, and international collaboration.

WRITE-NEW.PAGEDESCRIPTION: Write news for IEEE ITBA. Share your knowledge with the community.
WRITE-NEW.TITLE: Write News
WRITE-NEW.AUTHOR: Author

LOGIN.ACTION_REQUIRED: This action requires to be logged in
LOGIN.ACTION_EXPLAINED: An active session is required to vote. Log in or register to create an account.

REGISTER.PAGEDESCRIPTION: Register to IEEE ITBA. Join our community!
REGISTER.TITLE: Register

RAS.TITLE: IEEE ITBA
RAS.PAGETITLE: ITBA IEEE | RAS Student Branch Chapter
RAS.PAGEDESCRIPTION: IEEE ITBA RAS Student Branch Chapter
RAS.SUBTITLE: RAS Student Branch Chapter

OBJECTIVES.TITLE: Objectives
OBJECTIVES.CONTENT: The IEEE Robotics and Automation Society's objectives are scientific, literary, and educational. The Society strives for the advancement of the theory and practice of robotics and automation engineering and science and the allied arts and sciences, and for the maintenance of high professional standards among its members, all in consonance with the Constitution and Bylaws of the IEEE and with particular attention to such aims within the Field of Interest of the Society.

MISSION.TITLE: Mission
MISSION.CONTENT: Our Mission is to foster the development and facilitate the exchange of scientific and technological knowledge in Robotics and Automation that benefits members, professionals, and humanity.

VISION.TITLE: Vision
VISION.CONTENT: Our Vision is to be the most recognized and respected global organization in Robotics and Automation.

ABOUTRAS.TITLE: About RAS
ABOUTRAS.CONTENT1: RAS strives to advance innovation, education, and fundamental and applied research in robotics and automation. Robotics focuses on systems incorporating sensors and actuators that operate autonomously or semi-autonomously in cooperation with humans. Robotics research emphasizes intelligence and adaptability to cope with unstructured environments. Automation research emphasizes efficiency, productivity, quality, and reliability, focusing on systems that operate autonomously, often in structured environments over extended periods, and on the explicit structuring of such environments.
ABOUTRAS.CONTENT2: The Society provides aid in promoting close cooperation and exchange of technical information among its Members and Affiliates, and to this end holds meetings for the presentation of papers and their discussion, sponsors appropriate periodicals and special technical publications, and through its committee's studies and provides for the needs of its members and affiliates.
ABOUTRAS.SHORTCONTENT: RAS strives to advance innovation, education, and fundamental and applied research in robotics and automation.

EMB.PAGETITLE: ITBA IEEE | EMB Student Branch Chapter
EMB.PAGEDESCRIPTION: IEEE ITBA EMB Student Branch Chapter
EMB.TITLE: IEEE ITBA
EMB.SUBTITLE: EMB Student Branch Chapter

OBJECTIVES.TITLE: Objectives
OBJECTIVES.CONTENT: The Engineering in Medicine and Biology Society (EMBS) aims to promote the profession of bioengineering as well as the advancement of medicine and biology through the application of science and engineering. EMBS ITBA, for its part, and consistent with the aforementioned objectives, seeks to disseminate bioengineering applications both in industry and academia, through talks, seminars and practical activities.

MISSION.TITLE: Mission
MISSION.CONTENT: Provide tools and experiences to those people interested or involved in the sphere and public knowledge of the world of bioengineering, as well as promote the personal and professional development of its members.

VISION.TITLE: Vision
VISION.CONTENT: To be a fundamental pillar in the dissemination and realization of research projects, student congresses and transcendental issues today

ABOUTEMB.TITLE: About EMB
ABOUTEMB.CONTENT1: EMBS ITBA is a student chapter belonging to the IEEE ITBA branch and made up of students dedicated to promoting and disseminating bioengineering applications, both inside and outside the educational institution.

ERROR404.TITLE: Page not found
ERROR404.APOLOGY: We're sorry, the page you requested doesn't exist or some other error occurred
ERROR404.INDICATION: Please go back to the home page

IOT.PAGEDESCRIPTION: IoT Workshop organized by IEEE ITBA. Learn to control a robotic arm using Internet of Things (IoT) and apply your knowledge in practice.
IOT.TITLE: IoT Workshop

TEXT.1: Learn to control a robot arm using Internet of Things (IoT)! In this course you will learn about the concept of Internet of Things, and some of the most versatile protocols and tools to apply it. During the course we will explain and work with MQTT and Node-RED to operate a robot arm, starting with its lights,and ending with all of its joints.
TEXT.2: During this workshop, the students will be divided into groups which will work with one robot arm. We will start completing simple tasks, and then we will increase the level of integration.
TEXT.3: At the end of the workshop, the robot arm will be fully working!
TEXT.4: The workshop will be held in person, and given that the amount of robot arms is limited, the amount of students per class will be reduced.

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Do I need to have prior knowledge?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: It’s not mandatory to have previous knowledge on programming or electronics to join the workshop, all the tools to understand and create the programs used will be given during class, and the robot arms are already tested and built from the beginning.

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Who can enter?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: The workshop is free and open to everyone, but the amount of students is reduced due to the limited number of robot arms.

ASIMOVCUP.TITLE: Asimov Cup
ASIMOVCUP.PAGEDESCRIPTION: Asimov Cup is a robotics competition open to the general public that takes place at ITBA.

SUMO.NAME: Sumo, Mini Sumo, Pro Mini Sumo, Micro Sumo, Sumo RC
SUMO.DESC: Two robots from two different teams fight according to a set of rules. Whoever gets more points wins.

RACING.NAME: Racing, Pro Racing
RACING.DESC: Two robots race around two tracks of equal dimensions at the same time, following a white line over a black surface. Whoever gets to the line first wins.

FOOTBALL.NAME: Football
FOOTBALL.DESC: Two teams of robots play a football match, winning whoever scores more goals in a set amount of time.

1.TEXT: The Asimov Cup is a robotics competition open to the general public that takes place at the Instituto Tecnológico de Buenos Aires (ITBA). Competitors must develop their robots in advance, in accordance with the established regulations, in order to participate with them on the day of the event.

2.TEXT: There are 7 different categories, each one developed independently of the others, all running simultaneously on the day of the event. The event is part of the Argentine National Robotics League (LNR). Here below you can find the rules for each category.

3.TEXT: In addition to participating in the competition, the event is also open to spectators. In both cases it is necessary to complete a registration form in advance.

1.QUESTION: Do I need to bring food and drinks to the event?
1.ANSWER: All meals are the responsibility of each participant and should bring food or buy it in the shops surrounding the university.

2.QUESTION: If I want to attend as a spectator, do I have to register?
2.ANSWER: Yes, it is very important to complete the spectator registration form before the deadline in order to attend the event.

3.QUESTION: What does the Homologation consist of?
3.ANSWER: The Homologation is a verification that is carried out on each robot to ensure that it meets the requirements of size, weight, etc. determined by the regulations. In addition, a robot test is performed on the track/tatami without any opponents to help determine the distribution of groups for the group stage.

4.QUESTION: Who can participate in the competition?
4.ANSWER: The event is free and open to the public. Participants from any high school, college, or private team may participate in the competition. In all cases, the corresponding registration form must be completed.

5.QUESTION: How can I make inquiries about the competition?
5.ANSWER: For any questions you can contact us at ras.ieee@itba.edu.ar

TYPESCRIPT.PAGEDESCRIPTION: Typescript Course organized by IEEE ITBA. Learn the basics of programming with the TypeScript language.
TYPESCRIPT.TITLE: Typescript Course

DESCRIPTION.TITLE: Description
DESCRIPTION.TEXT: Intensive programming course of 4 classes of 3 hours, where you will learn how to program with the TypeScript programming language. It will also cover best practices, and things related to the Object Oriented paradigm, and an introduction of Functional Programming. The course will cover the basics of Internet communication through protocols such as HTTP. Simple programs will be made, where the mentioned characteristics will be observed and, finally, a file query program will be completed.

1.DESCRIPTION: Advantages and Disadvantages of TypeScript, Tools to use, Our first program, Variables and data types, Loops and Conditionals.

2.DESCRIPTION: Arrays, Our first function, What is an Object?, Special types of data, Types of comparison, Enums, JSON, Interfaces, Classes, Organization and separation of files.

3.TEXT: Third Class - Generics, Exceptions and Files
3.DESCRIPTION: Extension of classes, Generics, Recursion, Exceptions, File Reading.

4.DESCRIPTION: A look at Functional Programming, HTTP Methods and HTTP Status Codes, Development of a basic API.

FORMS.2: A quiz to evaluate each class (4 in total)

REQUIREMENTS.TITLE: Requirements
REQUIREMENTS.1: There are no requirements in terms of knowledge, except the desire to learn and perseverance, since it is an intensive course, especially for beginners. However, it is recommended to have a minimum level in programming any language so that it is not so intensive.
REQUIREMENTS.2: Regarding physical requirements, we need the participants to have access to a computer with any operating system, with enough capacity to be able to see the classes that will be taught virtually, and do the exercises.
REQUIREMENTS.3: Also, prior to the beginning of the classes, you would have to have all the programs (and the disk space) that are going to be used, installed on the computers.

BULLET_PTS.1: A text editor or IDE (Visual Studio Code, Visual Studio, WebStorm, Atom, etc)
BULLET_PTS.3: Node.js dependencies that will be used to compile TypeScript code (typescript and ts-node) and other extra dependencies that will be installed over the course of the classes.

REQUIREMENTS.5: In order to install them, an
REQUIREMENTS.LINK: installation guide has already been created

BULLET_PTS.2: In case of problems, use the preferred search engine to search on StackOverflow.
BULLET_PTS.3: StackOverflow as a page to consult the developer community.
BULLET_PTS.5: Participate in the class, through chat or by "raising your hand" to ask questions or clarify the topics.
BULLET_PTS.6: Do not leave everything to the last minute, since the content of the course is incremental in terms of what is seen from one class to the other.
BULLET_PTS.7: Use the Discord channel, created as a community of IEEE ITBA TypeScript programmers, to upload information, job offers, make clarifications, make inquiries.

FORMAT.TITLE: Format
FORMAT.2: Classes could be held on YouTube in real time. They will be recorded on YouTube, to access when necessary.
FORMAT.3: There will be a GitHub repository with what is given in the course (classes in ppt and pdf format, .ts files with what was given in each class, separated into folders, installation guides, requirements, files that will be used throughout throughout the course, such as the Excel file that will be used for reference in the last class)
FORMAT.4: There will be a Discord server, to ask questions about the course and to generate a community of TypeScript programmers.

1.QUESTION: What do I have to do to access the classes?
1.ANSWER: In order to access the classes, once they are recorded, one way is to go to the IEEE ITBA YouTube channel, and access the playlists with "TypeScript Course" in them. In order to access the classes in real time, they will be provided, through emails from the organization, the access links to it. The link would work at the specified time for the class you want to see.

2.QUESTION: How can I get the course certificate?
2.ANSWER: You will need to successfully complete and pass the weekly challenges that will be posted after each class. You will have to do it before the end of the course. Remember to complete each form with the same email address that you used on the registration form.

3.QUESTION: At what time and on what day will the classes be held?
3.ANSWER: The schedule of the classes will be announced in the introductory email. In any case, 24 hours before the start of each class, the link, time and day of the class will be announced again.

4.QUESTION: Where can I see more information about what is seen in the course?
4.ANSWER: Throughout the course, additional bibliography will be added with the official pages of the tools to be used, along with extra pages, such as pages with dissemination material, queries made on StackOverflow. In any case, you can always consult the developer community on the Internet, which welcomes you with open arms. In addition, a Discord channel will be created to see more information about the programming language, along with job offers, a consultation section, etc.

5.QUESTION: How do I download/install the tools required for the course?
5.ANSWER: In the introductory email, you will find a link that leads to the Installation Guide. If you cannot find it, it is also included at the end of the Requirements section on this page.

6.QUESTION: My computer has problems with the programs while I do things related to the course
6.ANSWER:
The problems found can be diverse.
In the case of finding problems with any tool, we recommend looking at the tool's page to see if they have a Troubleshooting section. In the event that this is not the case, you could send us an email commenting on the problem, along with all the additional information possible, such as photos, videos, error messages.
If you encounter the problem that your computer freezes a lot when you are programming what is seen in the course, or solving exercises or watching the classes, you probably have a computer memory problem. This may be because there are many programs running on the computer at the same time, and they can slow down some program, or the computer itself. In that case, we recommend closing any extra programs that are open, including those that are running in the background. 
 It may also happen that the computer you are using does not meet the minimum requirements for the programming course. In that case we regret the same, but we won't be able to help you 😢.

WIE.PAGETITLE: ITBA IEEE | WIE Branch Student Chapter
WIE.PAGEDESCRIPTION: IEEE ITBA WIE Branch Student Chapter

WHATIS.TITLE: What is IEEE WIE ITBA?
WHATIS.CONTENT: IEEE WIE ITBA is the IEEE ITBA Student Branch's WIE Affinity Group
WHATIS.SHORTCONTENT: IEEE WIE ITBA is the IEEE ITBA Student Branch's WIE Affinity Group, looking to encourage girls and women to get involved in STEM field careers

CONTENT.BULLET1: To encourage girls and women to get involved in STEM field careers
CONTENT.BULLET2: To empower women who have studied or are studying STEM careers to be leaders and entrepreneurs

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Who can join IEEE WIE ITBA?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: Any student currently enrolled in any course at ITBA. The only requisite is to want to participate!

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: Can someone that isn't majoring in Electrical or Electronic engineering join?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: Yes. We have volunteers from every major in our university. Diversity isn't bound to a single career

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: What does IEEE mean?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: IEEE is the Institute of Electrical and Electronic Engineers. It's the largest technical organization and its motto is "Technology for the Advancement of Humanity". IEEE WIE is an IEEE Affinity Group

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: What is an Affinity Group?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: It's a subunit of IEEE that touches on broad, non technical, issues which do not belong to just a single engineering major, such as diversity in STEM fields, as in WIE's case

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: What can I do in IEEE WIE ITBA?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: It's up to you! As long as it is in tune with WIE's goals. You can join any current project or even propose new activities. IEEE WIE ITBA is what our volunteers want it to be

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: How much time will participating in IEEE WIE ITBA demand me?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: As much as you desire. You only need to express what you wish to participate in and report the advancements. All of us are students, so we completely understand that sometimes we don't have much time in our hands. Just proactively inform us when you won't be available and everything will be fine!

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: What are IEEE WIE ITBA's goals?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: IEEE WIE ITBA goals are: to inspire women to follow STEM majors and to empower those women already enrolled in STEM majors to be leaders. In order to accomplish these goals we: put into the spotlight the work done by women in STEM fields, provide them the tools to develop on those fields and also demystify and teach about STEM

QUESTIONS.QUESTION: What is IEEE WIE ITBA's organizational structure?
QUESTIONS.ANSWER: IEEE WIE ITBA consists of 7 departments or sections. As the projects are the ones who belong to the departments, and the volunteers do not, each volunteer can participate in as many departments as they desire. Those departments are: Board of Directors, Media & Communication, Treasury & Fundraising, Logistics & Planning, Education, IT+D, HR

CS.ABOUT: A technology-focused organization made up of students and alumni of ITBA, dedicated to inspiring and educating in various areas of technology related to software engineering and technology.
